Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked my choice of classes, professors, and the area. There were good choices for extracurriculars. I was able to live nearby off-campus, which was a plus. Some students have an elitist mentality, so they are not always nice/open-minded, but it wasn't too bad. The biggest issues I had with BU were the price and the DAS office. I was lucky to have sufficient aid and scholarships, but not everyone is able to access this. Additionally, the student services for disabled students seemed very hit or miss depending on who you met with- I had some friends who were heavily discriminated upon despite significant health challenges asking for reasonable accomodations.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think that BU is overall a great school. There is a lot of opportunity that comes with going here like access to research labs, the city, academic clubs and student life. I've had an okay experience so far. Adjusting to college can be extremely hard  but it does get easier. Going to a big school in the middle of a city can be extremely overwhelming when it comes to finding your "people" and the activities/things you enjoy; however, it does get easier as the academic year progresses. I've really enjoyed the atmosphere of the campus and being a college student here. I would like to see more activities being hosted by the School that gage student interest. One of my favorite activities I've done here is pottery painting at a local studio which was hosted by the school; I think if they did more stuff like that it would improve the student life of incoming students as they learn to adjust.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is very lively being in Boston. It's super easy to get to the city and experience all the events Boston has to offer. The academics are rigorous and challenging while also providing a supporting environment.

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am am a graduate student heavily reliant on student loans for things like rent, etc, even with four jobs, and they refuse to pay out your Cost of Attendance student loans. I should not need four jobs to make ends meet solely because they refuse to pay them out. Definitely avoid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU offers excellent classes and does a good job on making sure all their students learn about a variety of subjects outside their major. The only downside is that BU can get a bit boring at times and there is a lack of school spirit due to the absence of a football team and the lack of an actual campus. Still, there are a lot of great people at BU and a place for everyone to belong.

Party scene is not super big, but if you really want to, you could find places to go out most weekends.

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Boston University for its strong academic programs, vibrant campus life, and prime location in Boston, which offers great opportunities for internships and networking. The emphasis on research is also a huge draw for me. However, the high tuition costs can be challenging, and I hope to see more scholarships or financial aid options available to students.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is an outstanding school offering rigorous curriculum, and world- renowned faculties.

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's a great institution with many open-minded individuals that is willing to help. However, the tuition bill is quite a challenge in a city that is known to be expensive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Boston University (BU) has been enriching, offering a blend of academic rigor, diverse opportunities, and a vibrant campus life. BU provides access to top-tier professors and cutting-edge research, fostering intellectual growth. The diverse student body enhances classroom discussions and cultural exchange. BU’s location in Boston adds excitement with numerous cultural and professional opportunities. However, the high tuition costs can be a challenge, and despite financial aid, affordability remains an issue. The academic workload can also lead to stress, so more mental health support and work-life balance initiatives would be beneficial. While BU is diverse, further efforts to increase socioeconomic diversity would enhance the student experience. Overall, BU offers incredible opportunities but could improve in affordability and student well-being.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is great school especially for people interested in biomedical engineering majors. The professors are most of the time student friendly and the campus is of perfect size. It is neither too big nor too small.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very fun atmosphere and all around cool people. The availability of internships is very good as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU offered me great learning and personal experiences and has fulfilled what I was looking for in an undergrad education. Not all the professors I have had are "good" at other jobs but there is a universal acknowledgment within the student body that the good and great professors more than make up for the staff who are new or should not have been hired in the first place. Anyone who ahs gone to college likely has had a similar experience with bad professors/TF and I don't think this has negatively affected my experiences or opportunities in my chosen career path.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is an excellent choice for people who want to go to an academically prestigious school and experience Boston’s vibrant city-life. The party scene isn’t crazy in BU, but the parties in MIT are very fun and are very close to BU. Some MIT frats are even in our campus for some reason. Also, there are many clubs and bars nearby which are really fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is nice. Very diverse environment. A lot of student activities and ways to get involved. A lot of things to do around campus.

Overall%20Experience.Review:
In terms of student life, BU is known for its engaging campus culture, with diverse clubs and activities, though the social scene can be a bit intense, with a vibrant party culture and varying degrees of involvement in Greek life​

In summary, Boston University is a prestigious institution that offers excellent academic and professional opportunities, but the experience can vary based on one's program and personal preferences.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU has been a great experience for me so far. Most professors are good and want to see you succeed, can be a hit or miss. There is so much to do (clubs, intramural sports, etc.) that sometimes it can get overwhelming, but there is a community for everyone in my opinion. The adjustment to the location was super easy, as there are students from all over the world going through the same thing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's super simple to get around areas since the "campus" only spans from one end to another, on a street. It's calm and quiet and chances are that a person may see someone they completely don't know a lot of times while passing by the sidewalk the campus runs on. Seeing that "stranger" becomes more frequent and its literally how people make friends without verbal communication. Sometimes it's hard to make friends because of how independent everyone is but as long as you aren't in your dorm all day, its impossible to be lonely here. Trees are always friends. You really experience all seasons here even if I've only experienced 2/4. Even if the dorm isn't ideal, I guarantee that the view outside the window is always going to be pleasant.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The pandemic hit while I was a sophomore in college which contributed greatly to why I wasn’t raving about my experience entirely. But that aside, BU has incredible, extensive on-campus resources, activities, supports and academics. I had some great professors and was more often than mot intellectually stimulated and challenged. I do not think the money was worth it for me personally because half of my college experience was remote/hybrid but no one was prepared for the pandemic. Should you experience a full four years on-campus, I imagine you will come to love BU’s student environment, the city that offers so much to learn and experience, and what you are studying. BU’s professors have made me passionate about areas I have never previously considered. I do recommend this University, but advise you to fully commit to the experience and take the most advantage of the resources and supports they have to offer. Get your money’s worth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Your experience is what you put into it, try to go out of your comfort zone and you will be rewarded if not it is a very tiring and dull experience at BU
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Good school overall. Great academics. Not for people looking for a tight-knit college community, but good for exploring the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I 100% recommend the best place ever. They are the most comforting and beautiful places you'll ever experience. Once and a life time experience. I'll never forget.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduate student at Boston University, I am immersed in a dynamic academic environment that fosters intellectual growth and innovation. BU offers a diverse and rigorous curriculum, with access to cutting-edge resources and distinguished faculty members who are experts in their fields. The university's collaborative atmosphere encourages interdisciplinary learning, and its vibrant campus community provides numerous opportunities for professional networking and development. Boston, as a city, further enhances the graduate experience with its rich cultural scene and proximity to major industries, making BU an ideal place for both academic achievement and career advancement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Boston University has been one of the most transformative experiences of my life, offering both academic and personal growth. Being exposed to this fascinating world of biological diversity for so long prompted me to pursue a career in biology. Nonetheless, a life-changing experience influenced my decision to major in Biology. I almost lost my father in 2016 when his inner brain nerves broke, causing him to remain in a coma for a month. Fortunately, he was blessed and is still here today. After this experience, I am even more driven to study Biology and become a successful medical doctor in the future. I got exactly what I wanted at BU: an amazing biology program and the experience of being somewhere quite different from the place I called home. My classes have been engaging, my professors are supportive, and getting to experience the first snow in a while was such a fun moment. I’m motivated to keep working hard and stay focused on pursuing my passion in this field.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The faculty at Boston University are not only welcoming but also genuinely invested in student success. Their approachable nature fosters an inclusive atmosphere where students feel comfortable seeking guidance and support. Each student contributes unique perspectives shaped by their experiences, whether in technology, healthcare, arts, or business. This blend of backgrounds enhances collaboration and innovation, creating a vibrant community where everyone learns from one another. Together, faculty and students create a dynamic educational experience that prepares individuals for success in their respective fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: In general, professors and the administration have been very flexible with letting me take the classes I want, which was very important to me. I find the area to be super ideal and have found some good friends in the student body. I’ve been frustrated with a  few school of music specific things, including chamber music assignments and composition studio assignments.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Sophomore in the CGS program here and so far I'm absolutely loving my time at BU. Most of my professors have been wonderful and I've learned an insane amount from them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Honestly I'm really grateful to be at such an immersive institution. I haven't had any trouble finding friends, the professors are pretty good, the food is pretty good as well, and the Boston area in general is amazing not only for the opportunities as a student but also there are many fun things to do here! I'm a sociology major, and I think that the academic advisor for the sociology department is great, I can tell he really cares about his students. I think another plus about BU is the fact that they accept many, if not all, AP credits. Just on AP credits alone, I've accumulated 24 credits so that's a lot of money saved. Also, they are partners with Questbridge and very generous in financial aid if you show demonstrated need, so if you're from a low-income family, BU makes it very accessible to get a degree here as well as many work study-opportunities since Boston is a college city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school is excellent. The classes are great, especially the foreign language ones. There are abundant resources at your disposal, so you can create many opportunities for yourself if you have the motivation to do so. As a Boston native, I’d say BU is in a great location. This school is definitely giving me the means to move out of Boston post-graduation and start a productive, fulfilling career. I really enjoy the geographic diversity here; although some  areas are more represented than others (namely the Northeastern U.S, California, and East Asia). As much as I like this school, the environment is very competitive and quite toxic at times. Speaking from experience, I’d say it’s important to maintain a thick skin here. No school is perfect, so I don’t think I’d ever give any college 5 stars. Nonetheless, BU is about as good as it gets. I’d definitely recommend coming here!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I transferred to BU in my Junior year to enhance my education and challenge myself. I found BU (Questrom in particular) to be exceptional in terms of academics. The diverse range of programs and the dedication of the professors created a collaborative and innovative atmosphere that really fosters learning. The historic charm of the campus and the bustling city environment made it feel like I wasn't trapped in a campus bubble. You will have unique experiences, meet amazing people, and BU will positively impact your career trajectory.

I do have concerns about the high cost of tuition. Financial aid opportunities were limited for me, which made it challenging to manage the financial burden of student loans. While the quality of education was outstanding, the financial strain can overshadow the overall experience.

The BU experience was well worth it. A top-dollar school, with a top-dollar price tag. Make sure your future career can afford it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: At every point in my education, I have felt like my education has been reduced to a transaction. Regardless of aid distributed, there are certain costs that the institution takes as granted for them, and administrative support in return is lacking. With the volume of students, recent tuition increases, and lack of proper amenities, one can only feel as if their school is adhering to the Spirit Airlines model of pay more get more. This is coming from something who is a Boston native and adores the city. The last straw was paying three dollars and fifty cents for a two consecutive wash cycles that did not wash my clothes. I stood there looking at my failed laundry and out three dollars and realized that I was not having a good time, not at all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just transferred here and I couldn’t be happier! It’s amazing! The school I transferred from was very small and suffocating, laying off many professors and cutting programs during my short time there. It’s crazy to juxtapose that experience with this school. So many clubs and opportunities, there’s a feeling of respect and prestige that I love so much. Even on my worst days (and as an incredibly introverted person with severe social anxiety) I’m happy to be here. I’ve gotten a little overwhelmed at times but it’s really been life changing and I can’t wait to spend the rest of my undergrad years here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University offers a lot of opportunities and has many great characteristics, but I also see many flaws since going here for a couple years. For the better qualities, I do think that most of the professors are good and that the classes themselves are extremely informative and worth while. The campus is big and close to some big venues, concerts, and you’re not too far from being in the heart of the city. However, I do have some problems with the housing. Each dorm is different but I have had multiple rooms that were in pretty rough shape. Diversity here is good in some ways, it’s not uncommon to meet people from any culture around the world and to hear people speaking foreign languages, but making the population more diverse would be beneficial. Notably, the percentage of black students at BU went down from 8% to 3% from the last semester, which is concerning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like how its integrated within the city you can basically go almost anywhere in the city since the green line is so close, it does still have a campus feel tho since all the buildings are concentrated on comm ave, and I like the academics so far and all the oppurtunities that popped up.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at the school has been decent overall. The campus is well-maintained, and the resources available to students are helpful. I particularly appreciated the student services and extracurricular opportunities. However, one area that could see improvement is the faculty. While some professors are excellent, there are a few who don’t seem fully qualified or lack effective teaching skills. I believe the school could enhance the student experience by investing in hiring more experienced and dedicated educators. A stronger faculty would significantly elevate the quality of education and help the school reach its full potential.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: professors are alright. some are better than other. The professor for your class can really impact how easy or hard a course is. overall Bu is an alright school which is close to the city with a lot of stores.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really like how the area feels. You get used to the noises and natural sounds of the city after a while. I like having the ability to walk, take the T or take the bus anywhere on campus or in Boston. A lot of things are really accessible and you can meet a lot of interesting people you'd be happy to call friends. The college community in Boston kind of brings everyone closer together even if you don't go to the same place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU administration needs to improve its relations with its undergraduate and graduate students. Recent strikes have left both struggling and impacted both academically and personally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent experience at Boston University located in the heart of the city. Can walk or can use BU shuttle or the T  to get to/from dorm/class. Cafeteria food is not great but there are Many options for food around campus. Great student life experience with lots of school clubs offered. BU Rec center is great too.  Dorms are old buildings some in need of remodel and upgrade with a/c but overall clean and well kept.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University offers a vibrant campus, diverse student body, and strong academics. Plenty of buildings on campus, many study spots, and good food!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston provides exemplary opportunities for experiential learning opportunities, and BU provides a myriad of experiences to help shape your goals and future aspirations. There are also substantial resources for mental health and wellbeing, and extreme emphasis is placed on fostering a diverse and inclusive university community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academics are very rigorous and professors are always willing to help. However, the dorms and dining could be better especially with the heavy tuiton.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University is located in a great area, very lively area and everything is close. Easy to make friends and meet lots of new people fast.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: An amazing inclusive experience. I have the ability to pursue any of my interests or career goals due to the variety of classes and professors. In addition, the wide selection of extracurriculars allow me to have a balanced schedule as well as aid in making me a more well rounded being.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I transfered into Boston University my sophomore year. Overall, I was placed in the worst housing possible, but was allowed to make friends through the experience due to bonding on the terrible living conditions. A majority of the professors are great, besides a few. I took 24 credits over the summer, because it was cheaper then the regular fall and spring semesters. I have also taken winter classes at other colleges and transfered the credits over. The dining halls are not great, but the food is edible. Sports are a major thing here, especially hockey. Joining a club is very beneficial and allows students to make friends, since the school is really big and you can find yourself struggling to make friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU is a good school for people who are extremely motivated; however, the administration is seriously lacking and it is extremely apparent as a student (undergrad). The graduate workers union is on strike, meaning many classes stopped mid-semester, are cancelled,  or no longer offer office hours or discussion sections. The RA's are also currently on strike, impacting housing for students. For a school costing $90k a year, they should be able to pay their employees (especially those who are also students) and keep the school functioning. Beyond these issues, the school lacks a broad sense of community--it can be difficult to meet people, even living on campus. And the administration makes it very clear that "BU is a corporation": they will do/spend the absolute bare minimum on students, and for most issues, you will be on your own. That being said, the academics are rigorous and classes are interesting; the professors are extremely well-informed and respected; and the location is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University has warmly welcomed me into a community of students, faculty, and staff that consistently challenge and encourage me to better myself. The beautiful campus and architecture is unmatched, and the care that the staff puts into the dining experiences does not go unnoticed. The group of students the admissions team has put together is incredibly bright and bound for success. I am so proud to be part of this community!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have truly enjoyed my time at BU. The professors are awesome and caring. The culture is great. The hockey team is awesome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: i absolutely ADORE boston university. i rave about it to anyone looking at colleges. not only is boston a great city, but bu takes it above and beyond. great location, great people, great transportation, great clubs. literally everything is fantastic!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Good professors, horrible dorms, social scene is a mixed bag, not a huge party school (frats are horrible). Hockey games are fun, the city is fun. Be ready to be overwhelmed by courseload.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love everything about the university from the party life to all that is offered for education as well as the fitrec actvities and pdp courses that we can take. I also love how diverse and inclusive the school is. I also had times where I was struggling with a class and the professor was willing to meet with me all the time whenever I needed help. In the future, I would love to take adavanced rock climbing and emt course if possible. the course seems to always be full right away though. As far as what I would change, the only thing that comes to mind would be more and better housing for everyone especially lower classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a great school for those who are very focused on their academics. This is not the school you come to if you want to party for four years. Every student here is very driven and career-focused. I am pre-med which is known to be a very competitive group of students but every other college/school at BU has similarly competitive students. Students are nice enough, but they will do whatever they need to get ahead. Professors are usually quite friendly and want to help you learn, but not all. School spirit barely exists at this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University took some getting used to when I transferred, going from a small, rural campus to a sprawling, city-based one. I've found that the environment here encourages independence and demands initiative. Talk to your professors and your peers, take your education into your own hands, and make a space for yourself in the community instead of waiting for things to happen to you. And, as best you can, make the most of the area's surroundings! Both the campus and the nearby city have so many places to explore and learn about.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an upcoming freshman in BU and have been on campus multiple times. The people are extremely kind and the professors genuinely want to help the students and offer resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: For the most part, I love Boston University- the location, the urban campus, the people, the academics. I think the dining halls and housing situations leave something to be desired, for example for both years I have been there a number of students are forced to reside in local hotels as the university cannot provide housing for the amount of students they allow to live on campus. I am also disappointed in the university's response to the recent grad student strike, as they repeatedly exploit their student employees and prioritize the university's wealth over the wellbeing of grad students and minimizing class interruptions for undergrads who rely on grad students as TA's.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The financial aid office has been behind schedule on releasing students' aid decisions and rather than communicating with students and their families, they have been avoiding all communications, including disabling their phone lines.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Some of the professors and many of the connections were not what I was looking for but overall it was a good school. Administration was also very lacking and unorganized.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University gives a student a safe and comfortable environment to thrive with top of the range professors while enjoying a new part of one’s life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a school very focused on academics. The professors are very knolwedge and helpful and the ciruclum is well put toegther. However, the school does lack in terms of social events and student recreation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University has so NYC to offer from over 100 programs to choose from, to staff and faculty who truly care about the success and well being of their students.  Located in a city, it’s also very easy to travel around the greater Boston area and get involved beyond the university itself.  I enjoyed my time there as an undergrad and graduate student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall it is a good school in a great location but for the price of tuition, housing, and food, BU does a poor job of being "worth it." Nearly $90,000 a year, yet it seems like they do not even try to put any of that money back into the school for the benefit of students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU has great professors, lots of opportunities for networking and finding internships. Socially, BU is an okay party school, but being in the city is a huge perk.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love BU. I think the people are great and everyone is very welcoming. There are numerous opportunities academically and socially. However, I think the cost of the school is mind boggling and they aren't willing to help you that much with financial aid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Greetings The Quality Control Process Procedure academics That i did experiencing over the short period time i been enrolled in BU. I really like the common wealth road that all the student are walking together daily to getting into the classroom with our classmates. The way the school control the courses academically and the books material should also include for the student not struggle in the book store to buy them that all good evening dear.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Hard to find friends as a transfer since there's no campus and it's known to be an anti social campus but academically very good
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a prestigious institution known for its strong academic programs, diverse student body, and vibrant campus life. Its strengths include a wide range of excellent programs, particularly in business, law, and health sciences, as well as cutting-edge research facilities. BU’s location in Boston provides students with ample professional and cultural opportunities. However, the university faces challenges such as high tuition costs, which can be a barrier for many students, and concerns about the cost of living in Boston. Improving financial aid packages, enhancing affordability, and addressing campus housing issues could make BU more accessible and support its commitment to fostering an inclusive and enriching educational environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like BU's non-traditional campus and ample resources, but I wish the dorms were better (air conditioning, size, etc.). I also wish there were more events for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like to see the administration care more about the students than lining their own pockets. The explicit greed shown by Boston University, especially during the most recent graduate student worker strike and residence life strike, is shocking. The administration made no effort to come to a compromise with either group. There is also no reason as to why Boston University had to have become one of the first to reach a yearly tuition cost exceeding $90k. The price is ridiculous, seeing as though absolutely none of the money that students pay is put into improving facilities, resources, and dormitories that would improve the experience of their students and actually make the cost worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I expected a fairly large change going from NYC to Boston, but I adjusted quite quickly with BU’s support. Their campus is generally very welcoming and easy to navigate. If you’re a city person like myself, the freedom to explore outside campus on your free time is a huge stress reliever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University was great, but in many cases (in my opinion) would prioritize the school's reputation and sweep problematic incidents under the rug rather than working to actually fix gaps in culture and proceedings.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really great university with awesome opportunities and insane academics. Really so great. Good faculty as well
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: BEST PLACE TO BE FOR YOUNG PEOPLE AWESOME PLACE AND CANOT IMAGE SOMETHING BETTER IT IS MAXIMUM FUN AND KNOWLEDGE MANY PEOPLE CANNOT CARRY OVER END UP IN MIT IN THE NEXT PLACE AND CANNOT ONLY FIND
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University offers a dynamic and enriching experience characterized by strong academics, a diverse community, and numerous research and extracurricular opportunities. BU provides students with access to cultural events, internships, and job opportunities, which is highly appreciated alongside the university’s rigorous academic programs and inclusive atmosphere. I particularly value the challenging coursework, extensive study abroad options, and the numerous research opportunities available across various disciplines. However, there are areas for improvement, such as the high cost of tuition and living expenses, the need for better availability and quality of on-campus housing, streamlined administrative processes, smaller class sizes in introductory courses for more individual attention, and enhanced mental health resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a transfer student at Boston University and I feel like BU does a good job introducing transfer into the school community. I do feel that the administration is not as efficient as other schools and you will need to contact them directly for updates and issues. The professors are passionate about what they do and they are willing to make accommodations for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the city, people, connections, opportunities, and help you receive, but the academics are ruthless and food as a vegetarian is tough
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy attending Boston University overall. As someone with several marginalized identities, it’s been difficult to feel at home compared with the rest of the student body and faculty here at BU. But I’ve still been able to make the most out of this opportunity, which has let me grow as an individual as I explore new life experiences and learn from them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Boston University is a great school. It has several resources that are widely accessible for students to succeed, even those managing challenging course loads. Boston University is a school that is filled with support, and amazing opportunities including but not limited to study abroad, research, leadership positions across multiple departments, a range of different clubs/activities on campus, and the ability to form close relationships with other Boston/Massachusetts schools (Northeastern, Harvard, Emerson, Berklee, etc), depending on the students' interests. 

What I like about my school are the opportunities that you can achieve. I just started an internship at Massachusetts Eye & Ear at an ophthalmology research-oriented lab. This opportunity originated from my email about being a student at BU! What I would like to see changed is an improvement in mental health resources for students on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: One of Boston University’s best features is the amount of resources it has. Seriously, there’s help EVERYWHERE for EVERYTHING. There’s drop-in advising, writing centers to help you with your papers or writing projects, student health services that include psychological support, and many, many more resources. Not to mention the financial aid that BU offers is out of this world. Of course, like every single college, it has its downsides, such as a few bad residences, a few bad dining halls, and a few bad professors, but those are just exceptions. Overall, there are good housing options, the food is great and varied, and the academics are rigorous and useful. And it’s in BOSTON!!! It’s so easy to get around, know the city, and find stuff to do. You just have to put yourself out there even if it’s scary at first. My first semester was hard because of that fear, but I’ve slowly learned to really enjoy my life at BU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a graduate student at Boston University's Questrom School of Business, my experience has been exceptionally rewarding. The curriculum is both rigorous and innovative, emphasizing not only foundational business knowledge but also the latest trends and technologies shaping the industry. The faculty members are highly knowledgeable and accessible, bringing a wealth of real-world experience to their teaching.

Questrom's emphasis on experiential learning has been particularly beneficial. Opportunities such as consulting projects, internships, and collaboration with industry leaders have provided practical insights and hands-on experience that are invaluable for career advancement. 

Overall, my time at Questrom has been transformative, equipping me with the skills, knowledge, and connections necessary to succeed in the dynamic field of business. I highly recommend Questrom to anyone seeking a top-tier business education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'll be there as a transfer, but really good experience with communication so far. Also very good city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: good location, could be better, but everyone says that. In general, it's what the average student wants.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the school but it is challenging academically. The social scene is perfect for me because all my friends are academically focused and all love being in Boston and exploring.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University has great academic programs, but their student life has its cons. With limited sports and location in a very bustling city, it can be difficult to feel like you are "on campus." If your looking for a tight-nit community, I would recommend elsewhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is an experience I look forward to as an out of state student. I have heard amazing things about it, and it sounds like a fit for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU is a great school. That is hampered by the administration. I love the classes, the professors are great, and the city of Boston is a fantastic place, but I have had few successes with the BU administration. This is further exaggerated by the high cost to attend. It is reasonable to have some level of expectations with the high cost, yet the college can fall short at times. For example, Warren Towers, a dorm I housed in, has 4 escalators and I can count with my hands the number of days all 4 have worked at the same time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love living and going to school in Boston, where you can meet some of the smartest and most interesting poeple I've ever met, and I love how the city is such a safe but still cool and lively place. The school itself is not very well managed and it seems they don't care about the experiences of students over the money and funding they get from donors. They prioritize business over learning.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University has a lively city feel due to its campus being integrated with Commonwealth Ave. The dining hall food is good and the area is very safe.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved BU. It offered me research opportunities that I didn't even know existed. There truly is a place for everyone, it just takes a bit of searching to find that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a student at Boston University (BU), I've found it to be an exhilarating and challenging place to study. Nestled in the heart of Boston, the campus buzzes with intellectual energy and cultural diversity. BU offers a wide array of programs across various fields, and the quality of education is top-notch, with access to accomplished faculty and cutting-edge facilities. The student body is incredibly diverse, bringing together perspectives from around the globe, which enriches the learning and social environment. Life here is never dull, with countless clubs, activities, and events to get involved in. Whether it's engaging in research projects, participating in student government, or just enjoying the city's historic sites, BU provides a robust and fulfilling college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy Boston University. The academics are rigorous and come with a heavy courseload, but professors tend to be very engaging and immersed in classes. Student life has the potential to grow and become more exciting, but you really have to push yourself to find ways to get involved socially, outside of the classroom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University has an amazing campus. One of my favorite things about it was that I am able to experience all four seasons which is really different from where I am from. I feel so lucky to further my education there and I can't wait to experience all it has to offer.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is excellent for students who are interested in research as there are many opportunities for this, but it does not support the student population very well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a great school. Let me rephrase that- Boston University is a great school for the rich and connected. The various administrative offices reflect this. As an example, the financial aid office asked me why I was asking for a re-evaluation of my financial aid after my sister died. For the working class, my parents, a funeral is expensive - once I said this, I felt treated differently from that point on. BU prides itself on its diversity when bias is embedded into the entire institution. If this is what it is like for other groups (outside of economically fortunate and white), BU avoids diversity. Though the institution has various issues (see the current graduate worker and resident assistant strikes), the professors and instructors are phenomenal. I've never had an instructor that wasn't a great aid in my studies. Though I come from a low SES background, the professors here give me hope that I can succeed in the world of academia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a great choose for a college hopeful because of its strong academic stature. The classes are challenging, and the professors are very smart. The campus is very big, but is in the middle of Boston, meaning buildings are spaced out and there is an inevitable need to walk. The campus is not very diverse as it is a predominantly white institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Housing needs an upgrade but overall dorms are authentic and nice overall. Dining hall food is good, various options.  I loved most of my professors and felt academically challenged which is what I wanted from my college because now I know I am prepared for the real world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Boston University was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in my entire life. My first semester was so hard that I almost considered dropping home and going home. I made no friends despite having large classes and almost failed my classes due to the lack of a support system. This college was not for me and I would never ever return back to Boston University no matter what.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like to see more diversity within the school of Boston University. I believe if you are a minority here you have to go out of your way to find your group of people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston Univeristy is a great school for someone who wants an urban college experience. As someone from NYC, I enjoy the location of the school as there is always something to do outside of the school. The layout can be a bit inconvenient when travelling to classes, but there is always transportation that easily accessible. It is a big school so you do not get much individual attention from professors unless you go out of your way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am incredibly excited to attend Boston in the future and continue to hear amazing things about their programs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University provides top-notch programs led by esteemed faculty members who are leaders in their respective fields. There are vast opportunities for students to be involved in research and internships and the facilities are excellent. That being said, tuition costs are outrageous and the general student body lacks cultural awareness. The administration claims to promote critical thinking, but they are very conservative in their management.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a huge undergraduate school. Therefore, you really have to seek out opportunity and friendships to find them -- it's not the kind of school where everyone knows each other's name. I barely knew the other members of my own major (Neurobiology within the Biology department). However, that's not necessarily the case, as there can be much stronger camaraderie in other departments like the College of Engineering, or even among Physics majors. While there is not a strong sense of school spirit and tradition at BU, unless you specifically seek it out (for example, I was in the BU pep band), I really appreciated the opportunities offered by such a large research institution. I got to break into cutting edge research by connecting with investigators at the Boston University Chobanian & Avedisian School of Medicine. I discovered a passion for data science on top of my aspiration for a career in medicine. Plus, it's BOSTON!!! It's an exciting city to live in while young.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University was a melting pot of students from different states/countries and backgrounds. Since I was a STEM major, my classes were quite rigorous. However, there is good support from most teachers and TAs. I found it most helpful to connect with other students in my class and form study groups. There was a lot to do on campus and it was close to the heart of Boston, so I wasn't bored.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice to be situated in the city, easy access to many things. Getting around is not too difficult. Experience could be better fi there was more things to do in the area.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like going to school at Boston University. It's in a central location so it's very easy to access the city either through walking or through public transportation. I think the campus is very diverse and has high-quality academics. I have liked all of the professors I have had so far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a great school! I have very few complaints, the professors are all interested in seeing the students succeed and all very educated and knowledgable in what they are teaching. It is in a great location in the heart of Boston which is an amazing city with a lot to do and the dining hall food is actually pretty good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is an amazing university that has provided me with numerous opportunities to grow not just as a student, but as a person. I am forever grateful for this school and the success it will provide for me. I just wish it was affordable. There is not one day where I don't regret the amount of money I am paying to go here and wondering if I should just transfer because of the money. However, I keep trying to remind myself it will all be worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University was an international hub where I got the opportunity to connect with people from 20= different countries. BU's academic level is outstanding and professors are passionate about the topics they teach and always willing to help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I think the school is very academically strong and there are a lot of opportunities in that regard. However, socially, it seems that the community is very distant and many of the STEM students, at least, struggle with their appreciation for the school. 

Students outside of STEM, in more funded programs enjoyed their time better and had a greater sense of comradery.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston is a wonderful city with a lot of places to explore both on and off of BU campus. The professors are understanding and very knowledgeable in their fields.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how diverse the school is. However, it is extremely expensive and I wish there was more of a community among the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is a profit business and feels like it. Getting financial aid is difficult even if you truly need it and the tuition and associated fees keeps climbing. I really enjoyed the academics here and most of my professors, if you are interested in research there are a lot of ways to get involved.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience so far at Boston University has been very positive overall. The professors are well educated and come from all different backgrounds which allows them to bring different perspectives into the classroom. The staff are dedicated to diversity and inclusion on the campus. The students also bring positive influences on the campus and provide a safe environment for everybody.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Boston University I receive a good education with knowledgeable and experienced professors. I feel as I am setting myself up for success in the healthcare field but would like more of a voice on where my tuition dollars are going.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I started BU when Covid was at its peak, so I had to do freshman year online. When it was time to go back in person, BU did a good job at helping us adapt. Overall, I have loved my experience here, besides a couple of professors who weren't the best. Boston is our campus, and with how big the community is, you can meet so many new friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Campus is amazing, organized by majors so you won't have to walk a lot. Food is very good, especially at Marciano's dining hall. The students are very friendly and the faculty all have tons of office hours and are very helpful. There a lot of parties in fraternities around campus. everything is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing professors, not the best social scene. Very introverted campus. I’m sure that is right for someone, that happens to not be the best thing for me personally. If you can overlook that, you’ll love BU.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I enjoy the campus environment at BU as well as the academics. I feel as though I am very challenged but have met a good balance between academics and social life. I have an on-campus job at BU Telefund and am a part of the Women in Law Club. 

I live on campus at Warren Towers and have made very great friends. The people are very outgoing, despite the city environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: In the most thrilling part of town, Boston Univerity opens a plethora of opportunities to students from all majors and colleges. From attending Boston-based events in culture to medicine and engineering, the university uses its unique geographical location to expose its student body to a larger community of academia. Hence, granting its students long-term success in their careers and self development.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a sophomore finance major at Boston University, my academic journey has immersed me in the intricate world of financial management and analysis. The second year introduced a more focused curriculum, exploring advanced finance theories, investment strategies, and risk management. The coursework, intellectually stimulating yet demanding, provided practical applications through case studies and simulations.

Camaraderie among fellow finance majors enriched my experience, fostering collaboration in study groups and projects. Engagement in finance-related extracurriculars expanded my network, offering opportunities for networking with industry professionals through workshops, guest lectures, and career fairs. Internship pursuit, guided by the university's career services, became a focal point, challenging me to balance academic commitments with practical experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University claims to be a need based aid institution, however, after years of fighting with the financial aid department and providing ample resources to prove my need to for aid, I was denied time and time again. I was eventually forced to take a leave of absence as the cost of tuition was putting too great of a financial strain on my family. Boston University has subpar academics, horrible student involvement, poor activity diversity, lacks club sport opportunities, has a horribly disorganized administration, and awful financial aid department,
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the atmosphere at BU. The people here are super supportive of each other despite how competitive it may be. We all push each other to be better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is an amazing school to attend. The classes are challenging and push you to think outside your limits, but make sure you truly understand the content that is being taught. Students have a lot of fun at BU. We work hard but also know how to use the city we live in to explore and have fun. The professors at BU are great, and work hard to provide a good education. The extracurricular opportunities at BU are amazing, and provide resources for all students to find something that they will enjoy. BU pushes you to search outside your comfort zone and try things that you have yet to even know you wanted to do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had really fantastic professors who were deeply engaged in their students' success. However, I do wish the curriculum for the Film program I attended gave us more exposure to the wide variety of careers in the entertainment industry besides directing or producing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Boston University has been pleasant. The city is beautiful, the school buildings are well built and the dining hall food is good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is an excellent university in the heart of a bustling city. There are thousands of students (undergrad is about 17,000 students). Everything is easily accessible and the campus has a lot of amazing amenities. Diversity could be better, but it isn't terrible. The housing could also use some work, but for the most part it seems like it's just a few buildings that students have issues with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU is what you make of it. Because it's so big, it's possible to skirt by and graduate with little effort. But it's also possible to get an incredibly enriching experience by participating in the various programs offered. Overall, amazing school that has a lot to offer for the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience in the city of boston has been amazing. The school itself has various pros and cons that make it overall an acceptable college to attend. Its academics are rigorous and allow you to receive a competitive education that stands out in comparison to other schools however this competitiveness the institution instills creates numerous obstacles and frustrations when it comes to grading criteria. This usually appears in the form of deflation. However, this school offers a wide variety of other areas it excels such as the community it creates socially as well as multiple clubs and activities that they provide. They are also very open minded when it comes to viewpoints and offering support for marginalized persons.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great campus, friendly people, good curriculum, but extremely expensive school, terrible weather, and some professors are completely incompetent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the atmosphere and overall nature of being in the city center. Things happen in Boston and there is always things on the move.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Most of the professors are very kind and are passionate about their job. They want the best for their students and are willing to help.  However, some professors are too detached from being a student and have been doing research for too long, they are not able to teach students effectively. 

The dining hall can get repetitive especially if you have dietary restraints and allergies. Some dorms are great and some are just bad. Considering how expensive the school is, some things you would expect to be better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a freshman at Boston University, and am enrolled into the College of Arts and Sciences. I have taken the Gen Chem and Biology introductory courses, and they are very rigorous but informative.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There aren't alot of student discounts but wonderful place for networking as a business, IR, or communications student. Very close to a lot of places to eat, although a lot of places close early. Low levels of greek life if that matters to you. VERY diverse, I met many firsts of races, genders, religions, and sexualities here. Not too liberla or conservative. Fun clubs and great people so far.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Extremely diverse and inclusive community. There are numerous student organizations where each student can expand their interests and find their community. The campus being located in the heart of Boston allows personal growth and a sense of independence and opportunity in the real-world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm looking forward to starting my program in January.  I appreciate the flexibility, and I plan to finish within 20 months.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a transfer student, I had a little more experience going into a newer school. But I can thoroughly say the Boston University is one of the best school I could’ve gone to. It truly is define by the phrase “Life is what you make of it”. There’s so many opportunities for students out there it’s hard to miss them even if you aren’t trying. I will say though, BU really makes you work hard. The classes are much harder than my previous school but to be honest, that’s a good thing. I’ve learned more in my first semester at BU than I had in my 2 semesters at my previous school. It goes to should the academic excellence that BU has.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a not bad there are a lot of opportunities for students however, the financial aid is not good and housing is on issue not to mention the lack of support from advisors. Classes are big so it's hard to connect with the professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU was a great school. Unfortunately, some of my time was change due to Covid 19. I took some classes over Zoom as well as some in person. I loved the opportunity to study abroad and the community that each major had!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have transferred to BU from a different, much smaller university in Boston. I really appreciate all of the opportunities that we receive as students belonging to a bigger and well-established university. The only downside is that there is a lot less individual support and you really have to know how to make things happen for yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boston University is a massive and incredibly diverse school with no shortage of options for organizations to get involved in and classes you may want to take. The only thing I did not like about this school is the student to faculty ratio. It is difficult to obtain the proper amount of guidance, especially as a freshman.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The overall experience is great. There are many clubs, events, and organizations that you can enjoy. The people here are nice. There are so many opportunities for you. It is very safe. The campus is located on the two sides of the road. Walk every day, which is good for my health.  The biggest issue is that the tuition is incredibly high.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: BU has great academics with knowledgeable professors, but career advisors can be difficult to connect with. The social life at BU also tends to be geared more towards networking than having fun and developing friendships.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many people from diverse backgrounds, and you'll end up meeting a variety of different people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, Greek life is insignificant at BU. You can join one, and no one will really treat you any differently. The nice thing about BU Greek life is that you can be involved as little or as much as you want - it doesn't take over your life. It's a great way to find a different group of people to hang out with as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The only popular varsity sport is hockey, and I really only go to one a year. The school spirit is definitely lacking, but there are people around campus that are die hard Terriers. Club sports is a great organization that is fantastic to be a part of.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Way too much Greek Life
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not in Greek life nor am I interested in it. Fraternities and sororities do not seem to do anything but party. Some of my greek friends are quite intelligent and nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a big fan of sports in terms of playing and also watching. I have only been to one sporting event. A lot of people care about hockey, but I have never seen a game, nor do I plan to. It placed 2nd in the nation in the 2015 season, but I could not care less.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There are some sports on campus that are more a part of campus life than others. BU is known for their hockey team and our school is very passionate about it. There are tons of students attending games. Other sports like soccer are followed by some students, but those who attend make sure everybody knows that BU is the team they are supporting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's alright, it's not huge at BU and you can't have houses on campus like at other places. They end up being cramped old places in Allston
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are big here if you want them to be. You can certainly attend games and have school spirit!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a graduate student, so it isn't really an issue for me.  However, I find it ridiculous that part-time students have to pay a membership fee to use facilities.  Honestly, it comes across as cheap and greedy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey is the number one sport at Boston. As a California boy, it will an experience to follow a sport that differs from baseball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm also not a part of the Greek life, but when people mention that they're part of a fraternity or sorority its mostly just a small fact about them that they don't totally rely on to identify themselves
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a theater kid so I'm not a huge participant in BU's athletics, but BU emphasises constantly their commitment to their teams in all the sports they play, and that commitment isn't unfounded.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Again, I don't participate in Greek life so I don't know all that much about it. It's also not a huge part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't pay that much attention to athletics, more so because they aren't my thing. However, for the people who participate they seem to enjoy what the school has to offer.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although this school does not have a varsity football or baseball team, their hockey is always one of the best in the nation with one of the stadiums.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't heard anything about the greek life on campus, and I don't attend the physical campus, so I cannot give a proper review.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have no idea as I don't actually go to the physical campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't a big deal at BU, especially because we aren't even allowed to have sorority houses on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey at BU is a huge deal and all students love to come out and support the team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: BU is pretty competitive is athletics. We strive to be the best as possible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in Greek life but I definitely am exposed to it
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The sailing team is technically a club sport but used to be varsity as a member I would like to see it be varsity again
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The main attraction to Boston University in sports is hockey, where many students attend the men's hockey games. We as a collective student body showcase our school spirit during these hockey matches, and often the arena is fully packed with students that attend Boston University. As for athletic facilities, fitrec is one of the most top notch facilities that offers students with full access to weights, cardio equipment, basketball courts, and physical trainers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The varsity athletics are fun to attend, as BU has good teams in Division I. However, not many students are into the athletics as students are at other colleges, which makes the events a little less exciting. I believe more students should be supporting our teams since our college is so big and the teams are good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: BU is generally a very accepting community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am not involved in Greek-life, nor was I ever interested in getting involved. However, I do think taht its a very good option for many people to find their friend groups and meet new people. I feel like BU's Greek-life is in no way too hectic and try their best for every person applying/rushing to find a group (sorority or fraternity) they will enjoy being in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are not my head of interest. However, many students at the university are very involved in the sports events happening. The hockey games are a very big strength BU has.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a large international population, but it is significantly Asian. Within the international population there is little diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I am looking forward to rushing a sorority. I hear great things about the greek life at BU
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic facilities are amazing
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: not a huge part of campus life
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: not the best in the country
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is there if you want it, but no one thinks any different of you if you don't join. Its just a nice addition to your college experience. There are also professional fraternities out there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Men's Hockey have incredible facilities. Hockey games are always a must-go, but you don't feel left out if you decide not to attend. School spirit is pretty high (especially against our rival BC). I play club sports and we are so painfully overshadowed by varsity sports and usually have to work against some of the Club Sports staff, but thats just how it is. FitRec is a pretty decent facility. I love it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We do not have greek housing on campus. A lot of sisters do end up living together on campus and some goes for fraternities. There are some frat houses off campus.  Greek life isn't everything at BU but it is a nice community that helps a big school like BU seem a little smaller.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't everything but they are an aspect of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics at this school are quality and have a lot of student involvement. The teams are good, depending on which sport you are looking at.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not so much for me
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I play lacrosse, love the fields.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not very large on campus, and has little effect on the social scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are not the biggest part about this school, but there is a large focus on hockey, and when other sports do well there is a good amount of support for them. Athletic facilities for non-varsity members are very good and updated. The fit recreational facilities have recently been renovated too to allow the best for the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities are not allowed to have housing. It's not a huge scene but it is visible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Once again, Greek life does not dominate student life. Even Greek students do not hold their non-Greek peers to a lower standard. Academics are clearly something that dominates.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: BU has a great balance between athletics and academics. Ice hockey games are the most attended and popular events. However, athletics do not dominate student life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not very big at BU, so it does not have much affect on our social atmosphere of campus. Many Greek students are friends with non-Greek students. You don't need to be in Greek life to "fit in" with the social life at BU - everyone is pretty unique. No Greek housing available at BU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: BU is not a huge sports school, so we definitely don't get the same experience as let's day, UCLA or University of Michigan (most likely due to the fact that we don't have a football team anymore). However, we have one of the best ice hockey teams in the nation and hockey games are really fun to attend with your friends. I have friends who are in intramural sport teams, and they seem to be enjoying it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very much like the stereotype seen in movies. You are judged if you don't drink, party, or smoke.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are great involved in all the sports on campus, especially hockey. Faculty and students always attend the hockey games and school spirit is very apparent in terms of students' apparel.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not personally familiar with Greek life as I am not a part of it, but from what I hear it is a positive experience overall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at BU are important and a great point of school pride and bonding.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am involved in the Greek life at BU, and I absolutely love it .There are some girls that I don't like within my chapter but I have learned that there are mean girls where ever you go, and that you can't let those people get the best of you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am really not that involved in the athletics at school, but I am involved in the dance curriculum and it is extremely challenging and the facilities are great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do not pay attention to the Greek life on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do not participate in, or pay much attention to Greek Life at BU. I know that there are several business fraternities and sororities, but they are not allowed to have houses on campus. Many of the members also do not live in Greek Life houses, but live in dorms like the rest of the students. I think most non-Greek students are indifferent to Greek Life, but some pay attention to the social aspects such as parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are very important at BU, especially the hockey team. Our gym facility is also very well updated and has space and access to every kind of excercise machine or sports practice area possible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not in one but have friends that are in Greek life and they enjoy it
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Personally I do not know much about Greek life but I know there is a great variety on campus. You can become part of a community service frat or a studious business frat. However, literally no one cares if you are part of a frat/sorority or not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, varsity sports are not a huge part of campus life at all. I have absolutely no problem with that but if you expect full stadiums and die-hard fans then you will be disappointed. Sometimes an upcoming hockey game is the buzz on campus, other times there might be a track meet with only a few cheering fans. There are more than enough club sports and if you are interested you will definitely find one to be a part of
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: everyone minds their own business. Nobody cares what religion you are.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not a big pat of campus AT ALL. But if it is your thing, then there are loads of opportunities for it. Most parties (for girls) are at neighboring frats, so it's always a good idea to have frat friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I never went to the gym, it was nice when I looked inside. We've got a rock climbing wall and lots of equipment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm saying "it's the best" because it's practically non-existent. One of my conditions for choosing a school was that it had to be one with very little Greek life on campus, and Boston University fit the bill. Sororities and Fraternities are there, but their impact on social life is low. Most people are indifferent to them, though many do enjoy their parties. I'd say they make a good impact in the community service scene, though; they fundraise a lot for charity, and that's pretty cool of them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The interest in hockey here is pretty high. Hockey games draw in a lot of spectators, some of whom don't even go to our school. In other sectors, interest is a little lower. Hockey gets the most attention and most of the fan support. Agganis Arena is really state of the art as a result.
