I haven't really been to the soccer fields that often, but I'd say they're very well kept, too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Many people join but not everyone. Those who do join love it though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The gym is amazing and I go as often as I can. There are enough facitiles for everyone
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: BU has a phenomenal men's hockey program (it's a big deal), and our basketball teams aren't bad. If you're into sports, you're pretty much limited to that as far as watching them, but getting involved in athletics is easy and very popular. If you're not into sports, you won't feel like you're missing out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not a huge part of Boston University. There are only a few sororities and fraternities, and most of the people here do not care very much. I would say that the commitment is not as big as at other schools like USC.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: One of Boston University's strengths is its Ice Hockey Team. Except that there is a basketball team that is sometimes successful, but other than that there is not much going on concerning athletics. BU does not even have a football team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Hockey team - best in the country and BC SUCKS

Our Gym - makes even a couch potato like me into a gym rat. Beautiful. State of the art equipment, shops, and cafe. 

Classes - so many classes to take at the gym from rock climbing to rowing to martial arts to dance. 

Club sports - a lot to choose from
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Its good that there is not much Greek Life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The school has amazing facilities and a great Hockey team but there is no real spirit for school sports. As in not many people go to watch them.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey is the biggest sport and that's it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The rec center is awesome. Would love to experience a hockey game.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is ok, they do great charity work but the process for joining a fraternity is much easier than joining a sorority and the process can be overwhelming.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The games are very exciting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not involved in Greek life. No one really cares if you are or aren't.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of school spirit. I don't usually attend games. The gym is very nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is definitely diversity, but very often people of the same commonalities stick together like sheep. There are people who venture out of their common circles, but there are also sheep.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do not participate in sports; however, the students that are involved seem both passionate and satisfied.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People involved in Greek life are typically regarded as cliquey. Some are more pretentious than others, and some truly are more community service oriented. There is no Greek housing on campus and only a small amount of students participate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: This is not a sports school. There is no football team, but the hockey team does have small student section. The fitness and recreation center on campus is nice, but small to the amount of students it caters to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I was very surprised with our athletic facility. Our school gym has state of the art equipment and over 5 floors. It offers almost every sport, including swimming, ice skating, and even rock climbing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't everything, it exists and people are aware if it-- but if you're interested, you have to make an effort.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are great, we have a great fitness and recreational center with amenities for the athletic type.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, the Greeks are friendly, there are the occasional snobby Greeks, but Greek life isn't huge here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The games are always energetic and fun, and for the students who aren't athletes but like to stay in shape there are tons of classes available at a well-kept gym, FitRec.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I never really go to any sporting events, but lots of people do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are many students from all over the world from different races, religions, sexual and economic backgrounds.  Certain foreign students tend to stick together and not interact but I have met many others willing to meet new friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's a little hard to describe greek life at BU since in the past year there was an influx of community involvement increasing from 13 to 17% participation rate.  Everyone is supposed to get a bid, but that doesn't mean that everyone accepts the bid or feels like it's an appropriate match.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our gym was recently redone so all the equipment is brand new.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are tons of international students, but most of them come from the same places. The large majority of students come from New Jersey, Massachusetts, New York, and Connecticut and know very little about the rest of the country. Almost everyone here is extremely liberal and intolerant of people with other political views. There is a larger-than-usual gay community at BU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't very popular. Maybe 10-15% of the student body is involved. While the frats are the main source of parties, the fraternities and sororities don't have much of a presence on campus. Non-Greeks don't really participate in the events they hold, and the administration (mostly Dean Ken Elmore) has made it their life goal to shut Greek life down. Many people in Greek life are so involved with other clubs and activities that it's not often a main priority for members. It's a good way to make friends and find your niche, but don't expect Greek life to be as active or prominent as it would be at a Midwestern or Southern school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit doesn't really exist at BU. You won't see many people walking around in BU sweatshirts or other gear because BU students treat life like a fashion show. We don't have a football team and aren't really known for anything other than hockey, so attendance at sporting events tends to be low. The hockey games are great, though!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The hockey team is greatly supported but I wish there was more overall school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sport events are big, hockey specifically, and very fun to attend
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: you don't fee left out if not in it
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: they have really nice fields
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The gym is great, as well as the soccer fields!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life runs a large portion of social events but are considered cliquey
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Huge lack of school spirit however athletic facilities are amazing
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It is not huge on campus, but you definitely see a good amount of people sporting their greek letters. The rush process for sororities is not that bad and well-explained, I do not know as much about the fraternity rush. Many people who participate in Greek life have friends outside of their sororities/ fraternities, and Greek life definitely doesn't consume their time here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although BU is a D1 school, there is not that much fan support and involvement despite game accessibility. However, there is a good amount of school spirit at BU. Specifically on West campus, athletics are much more prominent. The BU FitRec Center is very high quality-- many machines, weights, workout equipment, gyms, an indoor track, a pool, a rock climbing wall, and more. It makes it easy to participate in intramural sports or just keep an active lifestyle. Club sports are pretty popular at BU, although they do not have some club teams that you would think they have, like lacrosse. Their soccer teams are also extremely competitive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Since there is no football team, hockey is huge here. The hockey team is amazing and the games are always really fun, especially if you are sitting in the dog pound!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is Greek Life available to those who seek it out however not being included in it has little impact on your social life!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Overall- sports are not a big part of student life unless you are involved in them. However- Ice Hockey is a large part of the experience at Boston University! We have one of the highest ranked hockey teams in the country! Later in the season, going to a game here is like going to a football game at one of the Big Ten schools!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am personally not a fan of any Greek life. A lot are known for sexual harassment and racism. At BU, their only use is to throw parties, and I've experienced things that have reinforced my dislike for fraternities. They seem to be the main source of alcohol, and therefore the fun on campus. Girls are judged by appearance before they can enter and guys are required to be rushing or friends with a brother in order to enter. Sometimes, guys are required to have a good "ratio" in order to enter (5 girls per 1 guy for example). I once entered a frat party with my roommate where the theme was "ABC -Anything But Clothes" We both didn't want to be too exposed since the weather was getting cooler and we were almost denied access to the party because of it. Later on in the night, my roommate was touched inappropriately by one of the boys who was rushing the frat. She did nothing to encourage these advances, being that she was in a stable relationship and not there to talk to any boys. Another time, I witnessed an unconscious girl being carried out of a frat house because she had drank too much. There is no control of who is drinking and how much. The ambulance was called and I decided to leave. However, I believe this is a problem across all schools, as I have been to frat houses at MIT and Harvard as well, and witnessed similar things. Since sororities rush in the spring, I don't have much to say about them yet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not a big part of BU (which I like). It doesn't really effect the social atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students only really care about the hockey team, most other sports are ignored.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have friends involved with Greek life that are enjoying it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Love attending hockey games.  Students and fans are very enthusiastic and supportive for our teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know much about Greek life on campus because I'm not particularly interested in it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't pay much attention to sports on campus. Hockey is huge, but other than that, there is little talk of sports on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I can't adequately talk about the athletics, since I never attended a game on campus.  I'm not very into sports.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really know a lot about the athletics, I use the fitness center a few times a week and it is a very nice facility.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is basically non-existent at BU. Clubs are bigger than Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of space for everyone to participate. Many different places and activities to go and do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life really doesn't matter at BU. If you want to be a part of it, no one will care; if you don't, no one will care. They are good for the parties but MIT has much better frat parties so it's not a huge deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you love football, this probably isn't the school for you. If you love hockey, definitely come because the hockey here is great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life does not affect social atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People often go to sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't really have an opinion about Greek Life. I'm a non-Greek, but I have friends who are in fraternities and sororities. Greek life isn't overly present, but it's there. The frats throw great parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic facilities for athletes are some of the best in the country. We have two amazing fields, two ice rinks, the lifting room, and the boathouse. All are in amazing condition, and most can be used for countless events. At Head of the Charles, rowers always want to see the DeWolfe Boathouse. Its aethetic is amazing. Athletic facilities for non-athletes are very good as well. Our gym, Fitrec, has amazing facilities, including a pool, an indoor track, a couple basket ball courts, and all the lifting and exercise equipment that you can think of. The athletes also have the use of the athletic training facilities, in which the athletic trainers help the athletes with their injuries and to integrate back into sports. The club sports also have use of the fields and ice rinks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey is our big sport and going to games and doing cheers is so fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am a part of Greek life, but it is not a very large part of campus. There isn't really housing available.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is really all about the community. There are plenty of academic and special interest frats for things like community service, business, and film making. The social frats and sororities tend to be pretty tame in regards to party throwing, they mostly host smaller mixers. However there are a few unofficial frats which host ragers off campus and also the Harvard frat houses which are very close to our campus. Greek life is a definite plus but its absolutely easy to find parties and friends without joining.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: BU is best known for its hockey team and rivalry with Boston College. The hockey games are generally big events and the team has no trouble filling a stadium. The other teams don't really see much attendance at their games though, and women's sports are pretty much invisible. The fitness facilities are top notch though, fitrec is the nicest gym I've ever worked out in. It has a huge pool and climbing wall, as well as plenty of court space for pickup games of basketball and volleyball. Theres also lots of opportunity to take PDPs for extra motivation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Being a member of the Greek community is like being a member of any other BU Club. You meet once a week but it is not as involved as Southern sororities and fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Students do not go to many of the varsity sports games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is very cliquish but if you know someone then it still is difficult to get into parties. You definitely do not need to be involved with Greek life in order to have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: While the athletics are a big part for previous high school athletes, the environment and opportunities that it provides is such that those who did not participate in athletics previously can now learn and pursue new sports in a safe and judgement free zone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know enough to comment, although I can say from experience that the system for formal recruitment for sororities is flawed.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: BU hockey is amazing, basketball is really fun, and it's just a really great athletics department overall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life does not impact social life on campus that much, and you don't need to be involved in it to have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are amazing at BU, and going to games--especially hockey games--are a lot of fun, and most students go.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have a football team and as far as I know we have other teams.  I know for sure we have a tennis team.  Sports are fairly popular at this school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is definitely not as important at Boston University as it is at some other schools. The people involved in Greek life seem to love it, and those not involved in Greek life seem pretty indifferent about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm from Wisconsin, and have grown up only knowing the intense spirit at the UW Madison. Therefore, I was a bit disappointed with the school spirit and fan support at Boston University. However, BU does have very nice athletic facilities, and the hockey team does very well and is fun to watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Hockey is a huge part of the school culture and almost everyone attends the games. And of course, Soccer's "Terrier Tailgate" is the biggest back-to-school event. Besides that, varsity sports do not really dominate campus life at Boston University.

The Fitness and recreation center (Fitrec) is one of the best-kept facilities on campus. It offers a myriad of classes for credit, from marathon running to Zumba. There are also several external not-for-credit classes. The facilities are incredible, with several courts, weight lifting rooms, an athletic pool and a lazy river, and a rock wall. There are rooms for any kind activity available, such as dance and yoga classes and basketball. I cannot find anything bad to say about fitrec - nearly everybody uses it, and it is super well kept and feels new although it is now 10 years old. There is also a super yummy smoothie bar in the corner with healthy refreshers for after you exercise!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Boston University is located on Commonwealth Avenue, which is one of the main roads in Boston.  Because of it's urban location, BU fails to have a campus feel where Fraternity and Sorority life is not the main focus.  Many people who join fraternities and sororities do it as a way to meet new people and be apart of something outside of their independent lives.  I think that for a city school BU has a decent Greek life; however, it does not make a huge difference if you are apart of one or not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think that the facilities and athletic programs at BU are some of the best in the country.  Although we don't have a football team, our Division one sports team put us at the top of our league.  The Terrier Hockey team is one of the best ranked hockey teams in the nation, and have won many championships like the Bean pot Tournament.  We have also been able to have a brand new field for field hockey, soccer, and other athletic sports that can play on our brand new turf field.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We only make fun of sorority girls but no one really cares
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They're overly sensitive about noise complaints. Attendance and in-class strictness usually depend on the professor.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I've never had a problem with campus strictness. From my understanding, BU only gets involved if someone is needs medical attention when regarding alcohol or drug use. You should be on time for your classes, mostly because the professors respect you and you should (and usually will) respect them in return. BU seems to have a problem with sexual harassment on campus, but they are making a very visible effort to fix this. Tending to that problem unfortunately takes a while because the student body needs to work together with the administration. Regardless, they take those issues pretty seriously.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The administration at BU are there to help and I have had nothing but a positive experience with them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty lenient as long as you party off campus and don't tick off anyone else.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I was not too strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: From what I have witnessed, they're pretty good! I don't live in the dorms though so I don't know the rules there!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Officials are strict where you would expect them to be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It really depends on your dorm style and RA
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are only so many RA's to help with noise reduction and dorm violations. If you're having a problem with fellow dorm mates, try to solve it on your own at first. If they really won't stop, the RA's do a pretty good job in making sure the necessary consequences are given to the people who cause trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I would say they are about average. Nothing special, except Dean Elmore who is amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is a large institution, and the administration naturally runs as a business. They are for-profit and are not always acting in the interest of students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you don't make waves, there will never be a problem.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people go off campus to party but drinking in your room with a small group of friends is pretty safe. The campus security cares more about your safety than getting you in trouble so as long as you're not harming anyone or yourself you should be fine. Visiting in dorms is pretty lenient. There's a clear system that may seem a bit tedious but its better than some other places. Basically, every student with a meal plan can enter the dorms and if not, they need to be signed in. The sign in process takes a couple minutes at most. It's really straight forward and the security guys are pretty nice about letting people in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I love playing intramural. It's fun, cheap, but sometimes hard to join if you don't sign up early enough.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I don't like the greek population. Even though they are a small percentage, they definitely make themselves known and it sometimes feels overwhelming.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They are very strict about underage drinking and if they catch someone in the dorm even a little bit under the influence, they send them to the hospital, which is not only expensive, but sometimes totally unnecessary for the situation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Because we don't have football, all other sports are extra supported and really good here
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Boston Cops are so friendly you have to love them
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: This school is known for its diversity and being very accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not as popular or as crazy at other schools but that's what I like about it. It doesn't take over your life but is still a great organization to be involved in. Administration doesn't like Greek Life though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey is the most popular sport and we have an incredible team. Besides that, the other sports aren't as popular. FitRec is amazing and the PDP classes they offer are really cool.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They can be a little too strict with the rules. It can be a hassle to sign someone in to visit your dorm. They're also outrageous with underage (or even if you're over 21) drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part, the campus strictness is at a fine level for me. I would have rated this very highly except... they have a rule where you won't get in trouble if you call in help for a friend sick from alcohol. However, they get in trouble. A lot of trouble. So nobody wants to call in help, because they don't want their friend in trouble on top of being sick. This is very dangerous for the people who are sick!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Frat parties tend to get broken up by cops in the city, sorority girls tend to be annoying.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Security in Warren is extremely strict, it's a hassle having guests, but for good reason.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It does alright for such a big institution and with all the liabilities it has, but it is pretty strict (at least in the big dorms) about alcohol, drugs and noise. There have been a lot of negative stories about being harassed when drunk and taken involuntarily to the hospital on an ambulance. Academically, it's a balance between having so many options and wanting to do so much to actually being able to do what in so much time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good sports times to follow if that's your jam but it's not forced on you or anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: RAs are pretty relaxed with their rules but don't mess around if you break them, which is completely fair.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: RAs in freshman dorms are crazy. Quiet hours start extremely early, even on weekends. I know people that have gotten written up for watching TV alone in their room too loud. Visiting policies are pretty fair I would say. You do have to constantly sign your guests in, but that's only to keep us safe. As far as attendance is concerned, most professors leave it up to you whether you want to come to the class you paid to take.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School does a good job enforcing rules and policies, which enables students to live in a safer  and harmonious community.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I enjoy watching the hockey games, but I do wish we had a football team. The games are far from where I live and are sometimes difficult to get to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey dominates the athletics at BU, and then the rowing teams... our athletic center is probably the best in the country, and club sports (which I participate in) are very involved in competing and practice which is good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly Greek Life is not a big deal. It makes up about 10% of the population at BU and non-greeks and greeks hang out all the time so it honestly doesn't really matter. There re pros and cons of being part of Greek Life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Men's Hockey team is by far the biggest fan sport and attended sport on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All the above are great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Boston University is very strict on everything noted above, providing a academic atmosphere, yet allowing for fun and legal activities all of the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is strict against drug use or underage drinking. There are always BUPD officers somewhere in the campus too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Boston University is known for sports games in Agganis Arena. BU students are always desperate to buy tickets for hockey games because hockey is a big deal in BU. I once played trumpet in the PEP band, and I could always see that BU is really supporting athletes to do their best through various methods.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Amazing hockey team. Top of Hockey East.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is not that important.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not in a sorority but I have friends that are very involved. I'm not pressured to join. It's not my thing but I'm not excluded at all. Greek life is great for some people but not others. Everyone here has the freedom to do their own thing. It's a very social campus with many opportunities within the Greek life.... or there are many other choices for socializing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The guy to girl ratio is very visible on campus and the guys aren't that great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Club/Varsity sports can be both as popular depending on the sport, same with other club activities
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Varies year-by-year. Hockey's definitely what we're known for
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Everyone has a different opinion on Greek Life. I came in as a freshman with a rather negative attitude toward it (as do many students at BU). Your view will likely develop based on your college and friends, but I joined in my second year and couldn't be happier with my decision. It's hard to rank difficulty because there are some fraternities (and sororities) that will take pretty much anyone, but there are also some that are quite selective. 

A couple other notes: (1) the figures of involvement are inaccurate on Niche/CollegeProwler - 14% of the student body is involved as of 2014, and (2) the administration is very much against traditional Greek Life but much about its future is still TBD
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletic facilities are great, and the gym is amazing. However, good luck if you would like to create a new sports team. They will not let you.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is dead because of the strict policy BU follows.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I'd say overall the strictness at BU is average with exception to visitation in dorms. The guest policy at BU is extremely strict. Though I know these policies are necessary for safety especially when living in a city, it can be annoying and hindering.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The BU Hockey team is really big here
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It personally makes no difference to me
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Im not interested into greek life but I see it good and a great social opportunity for those that want to join something under that criteria.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The security at the dorms is insane. They make you fill out papers to sign guests in that don't go to BU, but it's understandable in a sense. Underage drinking is completely frowned upon, and if you get caught you will be called in for a judicial hearing. As long as you don't get caught, you're fine. Noise violations depends on the RA you have. If you have one that hates noise and any fun, well that sucks for you. Some RAs can be sort of lenient with that rule but it depends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a part of a club team and it's great. The varsity sports are a little more important, but we still get a lot of support. The facilities are great; FitRec is so amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't very prevalent on campus, only about 5% of the student body join a sorority or fraternity. However, the parties they throw are awesome.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Boston University has some great sports teams. We are a Division 1 school, but there are also a great deal of intramural and club sports that students can participate in. There's something for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I do not know much about the Greek life at Boston University. I am not involved. But I would say it's half and half. Some people are involved and some are not, but your involvement doesn't make much of a difference here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have attended a few events with Greek life. It was enjoyable. I have no interest in joining at this time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I have never had any issues at B.U.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are a very important part of Boston University. Unfortunately, I am so busy working, studying, attending meetings for the organizations I'm in, I don't get to enough sporting events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: People don't care if you belong to a fraternity/sorority, they have great housing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We don't have greek houses. So you don't really notice greek life. Very few people are a part of it
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have some stellar athletes at BU, but most of the student body doesnt care unless it's hockey. The attendance and enthusiasm at most games (non-hockey) is so poor it's embarrassing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Admin mean well, but I find the school to be very bureaucratic and impersonal
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey is fantastic, the team is being bulked back up, but football is obviously not a thing at all here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have friends from all races here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm too busy for a relationship now. Maybe soon. Many friendly, talented people here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am not personally interested in Greek life, but I can see some advantages. Just not important to me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They expect you to behave, and act like adults. Take responsibility for yourself and everything is fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I tend to exercise on my own. The facilities are good at BU, but they are far away from my dorm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Because sororities don't have houses, they don't throw huge parties like they do at other schools. However, if you're a girl it's very easy to get into frat parties, and most people in greek life or who have friends in greek life go to those. As for social life, it really depends on who your friend group is - if a lot of your friends like to party you might be pressured into joining, but at the same time if your friends are in sororities/frats then you can just go to the parties they invite you to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As long as you're reasonable and respectful with them, they treat you with respect as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: BU offers a bunch of varsity clubs, which are doing superb!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the time the administration is helpful when it comes to changing your schedule, except for the beginning of the year and new semester. They are pretty disorganized.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life exists but it's not very big here on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics department obviously has a lot invested in it. The facilities are great and the sports teams are some of the best.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol and drug use rules are enforced and the penalties are pretty severe. However many people seem to be able to get away with such behavior as long as it's kept down low.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Plenty of club and intramurals to join, but varsity isn't really praised here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The greek life is not very well accepted by the university, therefor it doesn't play a huge role.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: BU boats some of the best academic programs in the country.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great opportunities for different courses.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: BU has a very challenging grading system, but it makes students very dedicated to their studies and go the extra mile.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Classes are interesting and challenging. Phenomenal professors. Exams are always hard
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: So many opportunities, such great profs
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The majority of A's here are hard A's, depending on your course load. If you over load, good luck getting straight A's.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Lots of choices to choose from unless you are locked into a certain major with set course schedules
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: While there are tons of courses, the number available per semester could be larger given the size of the school. Registration is interesting. You're allotted a time slot during which you register for your classes online, and while it often causes panic, it's better than most schools. The only time I haven't gotten into a class I wanted was for the writing program, which all freshmen have to partake in, and for some PDPs (classes at the gym). The library is very dated and not nearly big enough to accommodate students wishing to study at busy times of the year.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Great Professors: Paul Blanchard (mathematics), Maria Gapotchenko (Literature), Rosina Georgiadis (chemistry)
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: We have great academics and very knowledgeable professors. Obviously it depends on the class and the professor, but the majority of my teachers have been wonderful.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Academics are excellent with highly motivated professors and peers. It is easy to build a network for yourself of people who want you to succeed with academically strong peers, and professors who genuinely want to help.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: In your application, they mainly focus on the essay, GPA, testing scores, and extracurriculars.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are so many different majors and it's very easy to change majors or even schools within the University.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm a PR major in COM. It's great because there are so many activities related to my major.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Almost everyone here is dedicated to their academics. Professors are extremely helpful and dedicated to their job. The workload is manageable.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Many courses take attendance, so it is required for students to attend all lectures (which really helps me study). Workload is not that heavy, and all the professors I met were lenient; they understood any circumstance I had which could have had effect on my grade.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love my major (health science), because it provides programs that are not only interesting but also flexible. This means that I have ample spots to take courses other than my major. Also health science program provides internship at my senior year, and I believe it would help me get a future career.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Takes hard work to get an A.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I chose both a major and minor. Some majors require auditions which can be tricky... sometimes you need a back up choice but you can always add a minor or change your major later on.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The classes are alright, I only got to take one major related class this semester but it was my favorite
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you're at BU, SMG is one of the best places you can be. Plenty of students go to top firms every year, and we only seem to be getting more reputable.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: In my nine semesters at BU, I have had many really helpful and passionate professors. Now that I am taking classes for my major, I really enjoy the material and content and my courses make me excited about my major and future career. BU makes it simple to figure out your course requirements to graduate, and provide helpful advisers who can guide anyone having trouble. With that being said, grade deflation is a real thing and you can work extremely hard for a class while barely pulling off a B. This varies between the colleges with BU, but it is a definite problem and has even been admitted by one of my professors, who said that his department encourages him to give low grades.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: its great in my opinion
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: COM is the best. If you ask for help, help will be given. Even though the classes are hard, they are definitely worth it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am going to be majoring in Commnuications. It is a great program, but in applying to the school I decided to apply for the College of General studies which is a 2-year program of pre-requisite courses. I did this because I wasn't sure which specific school I wanted to attend. This way I am able to complete my required courses all together then move on to studying my major.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I was excepted to work on a satellite project. It has definitely been the best experience of my life. I have grown from this challenge. I believe I would never have had this chance to do something so rewarding and challenging if I had attended any other University.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Enjoying most of my professors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The BioE program is great. Highly rated.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The resources fo rengineering here are very good. The EPIC design center is very cool.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: So many great options and majors here. Many highly rated programs, but Bioengineering is my favorite.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I found an internship, but not through BU. Worked at a company in southern California.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Grade deflation is a well-known issue at BU. It's very difficult to get an A. As a pre-med student, most of my classes are graded on a curve, so you usually just get lumped into the C category. Chemistry professors take their work and tests extremely seriously, so chemistry (general chemistry for freshmen especially) is generally very difficult for most students. However, the science program as a whole, from what I have experienced of it, is decent. Professors care and want their students to learn, and it shows.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: What they do first is they take the student's GPA (most important), decide whether to take the student in or not. Then, BU takes a look at your SAT/ACT scores, extracurricular activities, and then your essay.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The application process was basic and I had no trouble getting into the Engineering program.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: It is filled with intelligent and social individuals striving for excellence.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Registration is easy here! One of my undergrads had the most complicated system that never worked. Here, I log in and get what I want without any stress on my part. The workload is appropriate and my professors are knowledgeable about what they are teaching.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I choose to come to this school for the professors and because the program was one of the best in the country in my mind. The staff/ professors are involved in a wide range of activities and learning from them is amazing. You get a wide variety of ideas and inputs from professors and your peers who come from many different backgrounds.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I love my professors and advisors. I visited many schools and attended two schools for my undergraduate and I feel like the staff here really cares about me. I've had some unique financial issues and the staff have been willing to extend deadlines and help me out in ways that y other schools were unable or unwilling. The internship and jobs available are also unbeatable! If your professor doesn't know someone at the place where you want to work someone in your program probably does and can help you get a foot in the door.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: You can really find the internship that interests you. There is a wide variety of public health programs in the area, meaning there is a lot to choose from. BU does a good job of trying to tell you about different opportunities that are available.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I have not ever had trouble finding an internship although I have never looked for one through my school. I simply asked around my own personal networks. The work varies because I am only a rising sophomore. I have been paid something nearly all the time i've worked.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I have not ever had trouble finding an internship although I have never looked for one through my school. I simply asked around my own personal networks. The work varies because I am only a rising sophomore. I have been paid something nearly all the time i've worked.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: BU is a top ten school for Finance. And you can see why. It's rigorous, you really have to earn your grades. The curriculum had a revamp my freshman year and that had everyone a little nervous. Professors, TAs and student had different expectations and the organization of these new classes needs a lot of work.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: BU is a pretty hard school in my opinion. We have top tier professors, a hard business curriculum. The registration process is cut throat with people trying to find the best connection with class seats high in demand. The workload ranges but is generally quite heavy.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Really enjoyed my time as a psychology major. Some really cool classes to choose from and some really awesome professors to interact with.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: BU likes to see a well rounded student, so make sure grades are good, and that you also have a lot of extracurricular activities. They expect students who have been involved in a lot already, and will continue to enrich the BU community in this way. Definitely take a tour, visit, or contact them online to show interest.  They like that a lot too -- speaking as someone who worked in admissions for all 4 of my undergrad years!
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review:
Academics are "ok" here. I say they are "ok" because there is A LOT of grade deflation...meaning some professors will create exams and assignments to intentionally make sure students stay in the "B" range...not the "A" range. 

But it's not like BU doesn't want you to succeed...actually that's exactly what it's like.

Work your butt off to a "B" and graduate with a "B".
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: The academics are good. The workload for some majors is more than others. But academics are good. You definitely learn a lot.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: We have a lot of majors...literally any kind of person could find something of interest to them...if they dont they can design their own major.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: I did not have an internship and did not need one for my major. However, some majors required internships and those students got set up with good ones.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Some of the professors are fantastic and some of them are complete assholes.  The registration process is also difficult, but the workload is fine.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am in the business school and the workload is average.  The new curriculum still needs work, but the facilities are great.  There is a good career center, but most job success is through personal connections.  The academics are good, but grade deflation is prevalent.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My program is very rigorous, but I feel like I'm getting a great education. All the students know the professors on a first-name basis, and the professors really try to get to know all of their students too. They are great at talking to us, and always are available for office hours, whether it be for academic clarification or for just guidance.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: My doctorate program is great- my professors are all very involved and keep up-to-date on all the newest literature and technology. The facilities were just updated last year, so all the lab time is spent well.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Some professors are really amazing and can teach really well, others are not and I feel like the surveys we fill out every semester doesn't help much if the teachers aren't improving or being replaced. Some professors shouldn't even be teaching because they are very offensive and bias. Registration is fine for me because I'm a transfer student so I'm not overwhelmed if classes fill up because I'm not on the same schedule as everyone else. The curriculum has it's ups and downs. I think there should be more of a focus of letting students know where good study areas are and informing them about getting help/tutoring if they need it.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Workload for two credit courses is awful. They might as well be four credit courses. It's easy to get/find a job and our facilities are good but the workload is crazy.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Workloads for science classes tend to be more than other subjects. Some of the professors are amazing and the other half are horrible.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The workload isn't that bad, except for chemistry. I feel they add too much homework and the department itself isn't very helpful.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Strong essay is important, having excellent grades, and having something on your application that will make you unique and different from other applicants.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: To be in the nutrition and metabolism MS program, you need to be proactive because the professors juggles multiple roles. Do not be afraid to discuss academic related or professional development topics with your professors, it leads to job/internship/educational opportunities that otherwise would not be available. My program is small and relatively new, so the professors are attentive to your needs and such. The workload is heavy and to excel in the program, you definitely need to put effort in to it.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Very fulfilling program, but there is a large and heavy workload. Good research opportunities
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Very fulfilling program, but there is a large and heavy workload. Good research opportunities
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: I switched into COM recently but was originally admitted to CAS. Tips for general admission - get good grades, and make your essays interesting and make sure they play to the kind of students BU is looking for. It's getting harder and harder to get into BU so make yourself stand out.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The professors are overall great and useful except for a few that are just condescending and clearly cant teach (but i swear it is a minority!). The curriculum is very rigorous which is great AND horrible since expectations from your professors are high and must constantly be on top of your work in order to get a solid grade (not neccessarily an A. Grade deflation is alive and well at BU). But the curriculum is great since the classes are informative and at an advanced level. The main study spot on campus is Mugar but a lot of people study in their rooms, the common room, and the study lounges at each dorm.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Academics here are the best in the nation hands in. We are the best departments in the nation and top 50 in the world for philosophy so BU is great for that among other majors (econ,business, health sciences,communications, engineering, fine arts). But the academic advisors are not really that useful to be honest. But the career center and your professors are extremely useful and helpful when it comes to academic concerns and finding a job or internship. BUT you must put in the effort to reach out to them and do some work on your own in order to receive the best benefits from your connections.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Most of the majors have the best departments in USA
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academics at Boston University School of Public Health is one of the top in the country.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: The professors and curriculum are great. The registration process is done online and is very smooth.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Everyone here is either in a ridiculously stupid major like hospitality or crying over their sucky engineering grades
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Good selection, but many majors are extremely broad
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: HUGE grade deflation problem. Even if you have a perfect SAT and were a 4.0 student in high school, you'll probably end up with a 3.3 at BU
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My degree requires a lot of effort to remain in. It can be difficult, but it is worthwhile. For admission into the program, my science GPA was considered as well as my standardized tests. My program does not have an abnormal application process, it does however, involve more scrutiny.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The academics offered are one of the best. There are many different classes people can take and many opportunities to either study abroad or minor or double major.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The anthropology department at BU includes faculty who focus on all different areas of the world and come from a variety of cultures. The courses offered cover engaging topics and are attractive to anthropology major and non-major students alike. Although many courses have a heavy reading workload, there are typically fewer small assignments and it is more common to have exams and a single paper, at least at the average class level. The degree requirements are reasonable and there are opportunities to go above and beyond with additional seminars as well as the Honors in the Major program which allows select dedicated students to pursue independent research project in their senior year.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Our program is very demanding. There is unfair grading deflation which makes it very difficult to do well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: We have a giant department (one of the biggest at the school) and I have a lot of really interesting classes to choose from and lots of professors whose work really interests me.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It's really hard to get an A in any respectable major here but that doesn't mean we don't have great professors and classes that really teach you things about life.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Engineering has a lot of classes. If you're looking for an easy time in college get into the College of Communications, they barely go to class. The study floor in Shelton is nice.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I started as a Biomedical Engineer but switched to Computer Engineer within my first month. The process was hassle free. Have a good essay, they put a lot of weight on it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The best thing about my major of International Relations is that it is an umbrella. There are many ways to focus in and specialize in different areas of the world and different aspects of International Relations. My academic advisors are knowledgable and helpful with recommendations on which classes are best for me to take. We have many professors that are passionate and experienced.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I didn't do one with BU, but I know BU helps, or you  can find one on your own and they probably take it
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I am in a 5 year program for Painting (BFA) and Art Education (MFA).  It is tough and intense, but do-able and I even went abroad! BU is also know for its Art Education program in Massachusetts and if they need a teacher, they have called BU before, so there is a good chance that you will find a job after graduation (Art Ed jobs are very limited, they rarely call).
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: My occupational therapy program is no longer an option for incoming students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: BU definately is difficult in terms of academics, aka you have to study.  However, there are many interesting and unusual programs, and you can explore classes in other colleges besides the college that you are primarily enrolled in.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Really interesting classes. Very experienced and intelligent professors. Psychology workload is not too overwhelming at all. Great program :)
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you like being challenged in your classes, BU is the place to be. Regardless of your major, you will be in challenging classes. If you're the type of person that needs to have straight A's in all your classes, you might not want to be here because it is incredibly difficult to get an A. Classes are really challenging, but most professors and teaching fellows/assistants are willing to help you during their office hours if you need it. There's also tutoring available. Basically, you can do pretty well in your classes if you're willing to put in the effort.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Getting into the Biology program was not hard at all. It's staying in the program thats difficult!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have had some amazing professors and some not-so-great ones.  Some are very charismatic and funny.  Some are strict or don't teach well.  BU is known for its grade-deflation but it's all relative (most classes don't even have grade deflation).  Study hard and don't stress out and you will be fine.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I went in undecided into the College of Arts & Sciences. There is an incredible amount of choices.  I ended up pursuing a passion and switching into the School of Communications for Film & TV.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I plan to have an internship.  Many friends have been a part of amazing businesses including Apple, the Boston Globe, and start-up companies.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My program is difficult and requires a lot of studying and stressing. However, it definitely is preparing me for my career. There are a lot of internship opportunities within BU and around Boston.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Consistently ranked top 50 nationwide. Some programs and professors are better than others and intro-level classes are deeply mediocre, but the education is generally of fair or good quality. Registration can be a nightmare if you aren't a varsity athlete or student in the Honors college (the two groups with preference). The workload isn't horrible, but the grade deflation is.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: As with any school, all majors are not created equal. Some programs here are top ones in the world, others are pretty standard or even mediocre fare. Intro level courses are crowded and generally of poor quality, but the upper level ones tend to be received by the students.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm in a program of relatively small size so I appreciate seeing familiar faces. Not the friendliest group, but not competitive. Very competent professors across the major. Male dominated major for both students and professors.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: My major is very small, which is wonderful and not wonderful. The special attention is awesome but there are less people to discuss with
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Overall the professors have been very helpful. They are available before class and give out their email address and sometimes phone numbers. My current professor has been amazing and so helpful. If it were not for her helping the students, the quick email responses, etc. many of the students all agreed they would have not been able to successfully complete the assignment.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There is an internship requirement in the second and third year. We are assigned advisors which we meet with in small groups and individually. It is the school and the advisors responsibility to find you an internship, based on information that you give them. The internship will be difficult because many of the students, myself includes, will also be working full time while trying to fulfill the internship hours, attend classes, and keep up with class assignments. I know this will be a challenge, but I know it is to better my education and work experience for a future career.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: This program is great for those who work full time. It is an off campus part time program. Classes take place on weekends, Friday nights and Saturday mornings. Each class is about 4 weekends long. Classes are taken one at a time which is manageable for full time workers. While the classes move along very quickly the caseload is still heavy. The curriculum is the same as the Boston campus, just very condensed. The students are still expected to cover the same material that the regular classes that run 15 weeks cover, and complete similar assignments. You are often given only a couple of weeks to complete large assignments, and there are readings that are due every weekend. While the caseload can sometimes be overwhelming, if it wasn't for this program I would probably not be able to pursue this degree unless I made some major changes, which was not feasible for me.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: This program is a part time program and only focuses on one class at a time, which is great since most of the students in this program also work full time. This allows the student to only have to focus on one class at a time. Each class is about 4 weekends., and they take place Friday nights and Saturday mornings. Since the class is only 4 weekends, the classes go by very quickly but are also very intense. The curriculum is the same as the one that is taught on the Boston campus, but is done in 4 weekends as opposed to the typical 15 weeks. The caseload can be heavy at times and there is only a short amount of time given to complete assignments, some of which are research based and long. On the other side, if you love a class or hate a class, it is only 4 weekends. The way this program is set up is ideal for anyone who also hold a full time job as well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I originally registered as a non-matriculating student. I found this to be somewhat confusing because I did not attend any orientations or meetings prior to classes starting like the other students who applied did. After a couple of months I started to understand things better. I eventually applied and got accepted as a student. One important criteria for applying was GPA. In order to apply one must have a GPA of at least 3.0.  Overall I think the application process was similar to other colleges. One tip is the online application process. The application is all done online and submitted online. The references that are needed are also done online. The student must include the email address of the reference and a email with an attached form is sent to the reference. Two of my three references had difficulty downloading and filling out the form. My third reference did not want to use the online form at all, so I had to mail that reference in. In today's age it is much easier and quicker to do things online, but sometimes older generations who are not as familiar with computers have difficulty doing certain tasks.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There are plenty to choose from. I like my majors and happy I chose this school as they have a very serious program, for Astonomy/physics, some funded by Nassau! I would not want to be anywhere else
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Classes are easy and so are labs the exams are unbelievably hard, but I am in the two hardest majors on campus, many drop the course, but I am sticking with it as is my passion! Love Astronomy and physics!!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I applied without a specific major because I was unsure what to major in, I did not have to do anything special to get into the premed program
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm premed and there is a really good premed advising program here
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The chemistry department is wonderful and helpful. I wish the professors were a little more available but the TF's are awesome!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: First, academics have to be in good standing and test scores need to be good. Then you have to have recommendations as well as a really good audition.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The personal attention to your growth as a student, artist, person is unequaled.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors work with you very closely. Especially considering one's workload.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Deflation is your worst enemy, especially for pre-med.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: They're helpful but they don't go out of their way to help you; you have to be pretty independent in keeping track of what you are doing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I had no issues getting into my program.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors are all very knowledgeable and willing to help students. I feel like I've learned a ton in the semester I've been here.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: school is demanding but you are paying for the name
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: The academics that are offered are vast.  I am involved in the History and Computer Science portions.  Many of my friends are pre-med and law or International Relations.  The academics are as diverse as the school's population.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: academics are great. very hard though
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: It wasn't difficult for me to get into my program. It's fairly easy to transfer between schools within the University.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you love psychology, this is a fairly easy program. People seem to think psych is very easy and then find out it takes work.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: As a biology major, and someone who wishes to attend medical school my classes are all pretty difficult, but I can honestly say they have made me a harder worker and more dedicated because they push me to accomplish my goals as opposed to simply changing my major. The chemistry department makes it almost impossible to ace chemistry, but the challenge is good for anyone who can rise to it. The vigorous courses are also good for helping students decide if they are really interested in the field they think they are.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The sciences are wonderful and being in Boston is one of the best places for medicine
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Plenty of great options and opportunities for networking and average pay
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There are plenty of amazing options for classes and study abroad and there are some amazing professors. Registration is obviously stressful but the way it is done works very well. Students are able to change their entire course schedule up until the first day of classes without issue. Classes just tend to fill up before then.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Grade deflation is a nightmare and it takes a while getting used to being okay with lower grades than one received in high school
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I haven't had an internship yet, but I know that there are plenty of ways to get internships or research opportunities. BU is well connected and the staff provides plenty of ways to reach out to possible places or even talk to professors who might be conducting research. I do not have much concern about finding an internship.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: CGS limits your class options a bit your first two years, but allows room for one elective a semester. And the classes that you must take (unless you get AP credit) are very interesting and fulfilling (and they cover gen-eds). Every teacher I've had has been accommodating, intelligent, and passionate about the subject matter. Workload can be tough, but hey it's college.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'm in CGS, the College of General Studies. Not only do I get a taste of all the other colleges until I pick what I want, but the program allows for me to study abroad my sophomore year, get any kind of internship I could ever want at anytime, and I get to know my professors really well.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review:
In SMG, you do not declare your major until around your junior year. However, the courses you take up to your junior are very helpful in deciding what you are interested in. The introductory course covers almost every major in their topics. 

The workload is dependent on the class. Some classes have homework/daily work that is not collected but helpful in learning. In those classes, your exam and participation grades only matter. In other classes, you have presentations that also account for your grade plus written assignments. 

BU SMG facilities are great. They have state of the art technology and lots of resources for students.

Internship and jobs opportunities are huge at BU. Because we are in Boston, there are opportunities all around. BU has many resources, like CareerLink, to help students find local opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review:
Most professors are easy to reach at BU. If you are in a huge lecture, reaching out to your professor can be tough. Some professors don't care for students to reach out, while others like students who make an effort. Overall, the professors want to see you succeed and if you show effort, it will help you a lot.

Curriculums are usually straight forward. Almost every professor gives out a syllabus. Nothing is thrown at you randomly. 

Registration for class is assigned by the last digit of your BUID number. The numbers are rotated every semester so that students aren't always stuck with a bad registration time. 

The workload is always manageable, but you may have to sacrifice going out certain weekends. It's all about how much effort you are willing to put in. 

Popular study areas include: 101 Baystate, Mugar Library, Pardee Library, 2nd floor Stuvi2 and 26th floor Stuvi2.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The business school at Boston University is competitive. You need a minimum B- in your introductory/ freshman course to be accepted into SMG. I found the exams difficult, but if you reach out to your professors, it helps a lot. The most important criterion are your scores, your essay, and activities that you were involved in that make you stand out from the rest. The application process is normal. My advice for applying is that if you have below the school's average for SAT/ACT scores or GPA, have an outstanding essay that proves why you are still a great asset to BU and how you will be able to thrive academically.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love the neuroscience department. However, grade deflation in other departments is awful. In lectures, feel like a number rather than a student.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The school offers almost anything
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Academics are great but tough. It is difficult to receive an A because of the grade deflation.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The workload is manageable. Field work helps with putting what we learn into practice.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: There are a WIDE variety of options. Registration is very straight-forward and self-explanatory.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Great professors (in my experience) and interesting classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Bad grade deflation. It's the worst, and is difficult to do well especially in science courses.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I love my professors, they are all qualified and teach well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The school has a variety of majors so if I ever decide not to major in graphic design anymore, I can fall back on others. I love that possibility!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have not had an internship but I've heard that it is easy to find them at BU.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: psych is a versatile major If you work hard you'll learn a lot and do well, if you slack off you'll get through it but you'll be average (keep in mind because of grade deflation at the university "average" doesn't look good on your transcripts). the workload really varies on which professors you get/your concentration and if you're volunteering at a lab or something but regardless the libraries are great places to study if you like quiet and the GSU is good if you like to study with some background noise.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: in general the professors in the psych department are kind and knowledgeable. Again, no hand holding or chasing you down with deadlines (it's your responsibility) but they will make themselves available for help, just ask for it. also if you're even vaguely considering the possibility of graduate school (even if you're just a freshman) DEFINITELY find a lab to volunteer at.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Registration process could be easier to deal with, especially in regards to someone trying to graduate early. workload is heavy sometimes but study rooms are abundant
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Film and television program is strong-- lots of experienced professors and a diverse course load
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It is a really challenging major, but being an engineer gives you a lot of privileges around campus. The college of engineering is also academically ranked higher than the university as a whole, meaning we're the smartest kids on campus. The classes are tough, but you learn a lot!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Some of the classes are pretty big, and you just feel like on of the numbers. Professors are sometimes difficult to understand due to accents.
Academics.Author: College Freshman
