Housing.Review: Most of the affordable off campus housing is in sketchy areas with robberies and one doesn't always necessarily feel safe
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: It took me two months of searching for an off-campus apartment until I found one last semester. The prices are high (city pricing) and I'm still about a mile from the campus border. Safety could be better, but again, BU is in a city so it's hard to have a crime-free environment.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Overly expensive for mediocre dorms.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: Campus housing is between okay and great. While there aren't too many options, the good ones are really good and then the others are alright. I haven't found much to complain about, probably because I'm not too picky. Some of the dorms can be old. Cleanliness is really good and for the most part, the locations are great except when there's the big difference between east and west. The housing process isn't too complicated, but it's done by seniority and you can easily end up with a "bad" number. I haven't experienced it, but I've heard of summer swap which can help if you do end up with a bad number.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: On campus housing at BU is incredible! All dorms are very close to campus buildings/ class. Staff including security guards and cooks are incredible.
Housing.Author: College Junior

Housing.Review: Off campus is much cheaper than BU housing. Boston is great for student living and has tons of options close to the school and transportation.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: There are many different types of dorms at BU. There are apartments, suites, brownstones, doubles, triples, etc. The worst dorms are the freshmen dorms: west campus and warren. Other bads ones include Myles, HoJo, and Towers. The best dorms are Stuvi1 and Stuvi2 for sophomores and up. The best social atmosphere is west campus because it's close to all of the weekend activities, but it's more expensive. Housing is very competitive at BU and you need either a good lottery number or someone to pull you in to get into a nice place.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Totally worth living off campus
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: I can't complain about housing, because I couldn't afford to live off campus. Heating can be a problem.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: It's very different since there are so many dorms over a wide stretch of land, but I love the upperclassmen options. There are high-rise apartments, brownstone dorms/apartments, and dorms that were once nice, old hotels.
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Off-Campus housing is usually at BU's Southern Campus
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: The dorms are stuffy for freshmen and a bit run down but upper classmen get amazing dorm rooms.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: If you live in west Campus and you're not a jock or art student you'll have to be good at scheduling
Housing.Author: College Student

Housing.Review: I haven't pesronally lived off campus, but it's much cheaper than on campus and it's pretty okay from what I've heard.
Housing.Author: College Student

Housing.Review: You really have to make an effort to be friendly, even when there are a lot of jerks on campus. It's very easy to isolate yourself. The cleanliness in the bathrooms are poor. I live on an all girls' floor and there is blood everywhere. My friend had a mushroom grow in her shower.
Housing.Author: College Freshman

Housing.Review: some of the dorms are far from the main campus or are a little more old and crumbly but in general you're never too far from what you need. Myles Standish is nice (not so much the Annex) and Warren is only good if you're looking for a stereotypical freshman dorm. the process of housing isn't complicated, it mostly just depends on how good your number is for the lottery, when in doubt just ask for help. They won't chase you down or hold your hand at BU but if you ever need something there are plenty of resources for you.
Housing.Author: Recent Alumnus

Housing.Review: The campus housing is okay.
Housing.Author: College Senior

Housing.Review: in the city so space is limited but quaint and location is awesome
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: Definitely a lot of options
Housing.Author: College Sophomore

Housing.Review: it's small and expensive, but the off-campus stuff isn't much better.
Housing.Author: College Freshman
